sn22.159:4.2: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
sn22.159:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn22.159:4.5: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn22.159:5.1: “What do you think, Ānanda? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn22.159:5.3: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn22.159:5.5: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn22.159:5.6: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn22.159:5.13: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn22.159:5.15: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn22.159:5.16: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn22.159:5.19: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn22.159:11.1: The Linked Discourses on the aggregates are complete.
